experiment: F-EMP4 alterity measurement in handoff predictions
method: Content analysis of 55 'Next:' prediction blocks from NEXT.md and NEXT-ARCHIVE.md across sessions S353-S368. Each prediction classified as SELF-PROJ (imperative, assumes identical capabilities), MIXED (weak/conditional other-modeling), or OTHER-MODEL (genuine future-session awareness).
expect: Self-projection >80%, alterity ratio <20%. Level-1 modeling only.
diff: Predicted <20% alterity, got 5.5% â€” even lower than expected. Key surprise: the actual/diff sections of session notes exhibit rich concurrent awareness but this does not propagate into Next: predictions. The format structurally enforces self-projection.

genuine_other_model_cases.type: names different AI tools as distinct capability nodes

key_asymmetry: Sessions EXPERIENCE concurrent preemption (~80% of actual/diff fields mention it) but generate self-projecting predictions (<5% concurrent hedges in Next:). The handoff format structurally produces self-projection regardless of lived experience.
falsification_result: F-EMP4 test: 'If all predictions assume next node is identical, alterity is zero.' Result: alterity is near-zero (5.5%). CONFIRMED: handoffs exhibit minimal other-modeling.
next: Add structural context markers to Next: format
Re-measure at S390 after format change
